column1: The curate rode first on the mule
column2: and with him rode Don Quixote and the princess. The others
column6: followed on foot.And as they rode
column7: Don Quixote said to the damsel: "Madam
column8: let me entreat your highness to lead the way that most pleaseth you."Before she could answer
column9: the curate said: "Towards what kingdoms would you travel? Are you for your native land of Micomicon?"She
column10: who knew very well what to answer
column14: my way lies towards that kingdom.""If it be so
column15: said the curate, you must pass through the village where I dwell
column16: and from thence your ladyship must take the road to Carthagena
column18: if you have a prosperous journey
column19: you may come within the space of nine years to the Lake Meona
column21: which stands on this side of your highness's kingdom some hundred days' journey or more."
